boat.name: Nanette
boat.full_description:
'Nanette' was built by Crossfields, Arnside in 1933 at a cost of £169 4s 5d, for Mr Palin. When Arthur Ransome visited Crossfields in January, 1933 he notes in his diary a yacht has just started to be built - this may be 'Nanette'.

She took part in the 1935 Fleetwood to Isle of Man Race, along with 'Ploughboy' and 'Lalla Rookh'. Her owner was recorded as Mr Palin.

In a 1945 letter, Arthur Ransome referred to 'Nanette' as being 'a little beauty' and Crossfields, the builders as his old friends.
boat.construction_details: Larch carvel on sawn oak, transom ended counter, else typical nobby build
boat.short_description: 'Nanette' was built at Arnside in 1933. She has a classic yacht form, with curved raking transom on a counter, typical of the Crossfield yard.
